statements.name: PROC MVPMODEL
statements.description: invokes the MVPMODEL procedure and optionally identifies input and output data sets, specifies details of the analyses performed, and controls displayed output
statements.help:
PROC MVPMODEL <options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	ID  variables;                 
	VAR  variables;

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: computes the principal components from the covariance matrix instead of the correlation matrix

arguments.name: CV=
arguments.description: performs cross-validation to determine the number of principal components

arguments.name: ONE
arguments.description: determines the number of principal components by performing one-at-a-time cross validation, in which each observation group contains one observation and each variable group contains one variable

arguments.name: BLOCK
arguments.description: determines the number of principal components by performing blocked cross validation, in which observation groups consist of blocks of nobs consecutive observations and variable groups consist of blocks of nvar consecutive variables

arguments.name: NOBS=
arguments.description: specifies that observation groups consist of blocks of nobs consecutive observations from the input data; the default is 7

arguments.name: NVAR=
arguments.description: specifies that variable groups consist of blocks of nvar consecutive variables from the input data; the default is 7

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: determines the number of principal components by performing split-sample cross validation, in which observation groups are formed by selecting every nobsth observation and variable groups are formed by selecting very nvarth variable

arguments.name: NOBS=
arguments.description: specifies that observation groups be created by selecting every nobsth observation from the input data; the default is 7

arguments.name: NVAR=
arguments.description: specifies that variable groups be created by selecting every nvarth variable from the input data; the default is 7

arguments.name: RANDOM
arguments.description: determines the number of principal components by performing cross validation in which observations and variables are assigned to groups randomly

arguments.name: NITEROBS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of observation groups; the default is 10

arguments.name: NITERVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of variable groups; the default is 10

arguments.name: NTESTOBS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of observations in each observation group; the default is one-tenth the total number of observations

arguments.name: NTESTVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of variables in each variable group; the default is one-tenth the total number of variables

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies an integer used to start the pseudorandom number generator for selecting the random test set; by default, the seed is generated by reading the time of day from the computer's clock

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the input SAS data set to be analyzed; by default, the procedure uses the most recently created SAS data set

arguments.name: MISSING=
arguments.description: specifies how observations with missing values are to be handled in computing the fit

arguments.name: AVG
arguments.description: specifies that the fit be computed by replacing missing values of a process variable with the average of its nonmissing values

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: the default, excludes observations with missing values for any process variables from the analysis

arguments.name: NCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies the number of principal components to extract; the default is min {15,p,N}, where p is the number of process variables and N is the number of observations (runs)

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: extracts all of the principal components and overrides the limit of 15 principal components

arguments.name: NOCENTER
arguments.description: suppresses centering of the process variables before fitting; this is useful if the variables are already centered and scaled

arguments.name: NOCVSTDIZE
arguments.description: suppresses re-centering and rescaling of the process variables before each model is fit in the cross validation

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the display of all results, both tabular and graphical; this is useful when you want to produce only output data sets

arguments.name: NOSCALE
arguments.description: suppresses scaling of the process variables before fitting; this is useful if the variables are already centered and scaled

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: creates an output data set that contains all the original data from the input data set, principal component scores, and multivariate summary statistics

arguments.name: OUTLOADINGS=
arguments.description: creates an output data set that contains the loadings for the principal components and the eigenvalues of the correlation (or covariance) matrix

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics; when you specify only one plot request, you can omit the parentheses around the plot request

arguments.name: FLIP
arguments.description: interchanges the X-axis and Y-axis dimensions for all score and loading plots

arguments.name: NCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies that pairwise score and loading plots be produced for the first n principal components; the default is 5 or the total number of components, whichever is smaller

arguments.name: ONLY
arguments.description: suppresses the default plots and displays only plots that are specifically requested

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all appropriate plots

arguments.name: CVPLOT
arguments.description: produces a plot that displays the results of the cross validation and R-square analysis

arguments.name: LOADINGS
arguments.description: produces a matrix of pairwise scatter plots of the principal component loadings

arguments.name: FLIP
arguments.description: flips or interchanges the X-axis and Y-axis dimensions of the loading plots

arguments.name: NCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies that pairwise loading plots be produced for the first n principal components

arguments.name: UNPACKPANEL
arguments.description: suppresses paneling of loading plots

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the display of all plots

arguments.name: SCORES
arguments.description: produces pairwise scatter plots of the principal component scores

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the probability used to compute a prediction ellipse that is overlaid on the score plot; the default is 0.05

arguments.name: ELLIPSE
arguments.description: requests that a prediction ellipse be overlaid on the principal component score plots

arguments.name: FLIP
arguments.description: flips or interchanges the X-axis and Y-axis dimensions of the score plots

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable in the input data set used to group the points on the score plots

arguments.name: LABELS=
arguments.description: specifies which points in the score plots to label with the values of the first variable listed in the ID statement, or the observation number if no ID statement is specified

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: the default if you specify UNPACKPANEL, labels all points

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: the default if you do not specify UNPACKPANEL, labels none of the points

arguments.name: OUTSIDE
arguments.description: labels only the points outside the confidence ellipse, if you specify the ELLIPSE and UNPACKPANEL options

arguments.name: NCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies that pairwise score plots be produced for the first n principal components

arguments.name: UNPACKPANEL
arguments.description: displays each score plot in a separate panel instead of displaying them all in a single output panel

arguments.name: SCREE
arguments.description: produces a scree plot of eigenvalues and a variance-explained plot

arguments.name: UNPACKPANEL
arguments.description: displays the scree plot of eigenvalues and variance-explained plot in separate panels rather than a single output panel

arguments.name: PREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies a prefix for naming the principal component scores in the OUT= data set; by default, the names are Prin1, Prin2,..., Prinj

arguments.name: RPREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies a prefix for naming the residual variables in the OUT= data set; the default is R_

arguments.name: STDSCORES
arguments.description: standardizes the principal component scores in the OUT= data set to unit variance

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: ID
statements.description: specifies variables to display in tooltips when you create HTML output and specify the IMAGEMAP option in the ODS GRAPHICS statement; also, the first variable is used to label observations in score plots for principal components

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: specifies the process variables and their order in the results; by default, if you omit the VAR statement, the MVPMODEL procedure analyzes all numeric variables that are not listed in the BY or ID statement
